thread.title: 'I'm gutted': Shocked Scarlett Moffatt speaks out as Channel 4 bosses axe her family from Gogglebox
thread.title_full: 'I'm gutted': Shocked Scarlett Moffatt speaks out as Channel 4 bosses axe her family from Gogglebox

author: Nicola Agius
title: 'I'm gutted': Shocked Scarlett Moffatt speaks out as Channel 4 bosses axe her family from Gogglebox
text:
Get celebs     
Scarlett Moffatt has opened up about her family being axed from Gogglebox . 
Bosses decided to leave mum Betty, dad Mark and sister Ava-Grace out of the next series following her success on I’m A Celebrity. 
While she hasn't slammed Channel 4 for the move, Scarlett has admitted she didn't expect producers to take such extreme measures. 
Taking to Twitter earlier today, the jungle queen posted a picture of herself with her parents at the National Television Awards. Betty Moffatt, MarkMoffatt, Scarlett Moffatt (Photo: Splash News) 
She captioned the image: "We are going to miss doing #gogglebox so so much but can’t wait to watch the new series (good luck my fellow goggleboxers you will smash it love the Moffatts)." Read More Scarlett Moffatt’s parents have been dropped from Gogglebox – because she's now a star herself 
The reality beauty then admitted she was "gutted" her family had been dropped from the show. Bosses decided to leave mum Betty, dad Mark and sister Ava-Grace out of the next series following her success on I’m A Celebrity (Photo: ITV) 
Replying to a fan on Twitter, she wrote: "We are gutted too, thought my Mam and dad (and little Ava) would still be able to do it but we will still be watching #gogglebox." 
Betty, Mark and Ava-Grace have been regulars on the hit Channel 4 show, critiquing shows from their sofa in Bishop Auckland, Co Durham. Scarlett wasn't expecting Channel 4 bosses to do THAT (Photo: Newcastle Chronicle) 
But a spokeswoman for the series, which returns on Friday, confirmed last night: “The Moffatt family will not be appearing in this series.” 
And a telly insider said: “The whole premise of Gogglebox is normal people commenting on the TV. Scarlett is now a celebrity in her own right so it made sense she wouldn’t continue. 
“She and her parents came as a package. It wouldn’t work so well without all three of them.” Gogglebox - The Moffat family - Dad Mark (49), mum Betty (45) and daughter Scarlett Moffatt (Photo: Channel 4) 
Betty, 46, and Mark, 50, were not on screen in the last series because it clashed with Scarlett joining campmates in Australia. 
Shortly before the I’m A Celeb final in December, Betty said it was “up to Channel 4” whether they continued on Gogglebox. 
Scarlett, who attended the National Television Awards in London with her parents last month, is lined up to join Ant and Dec for the new series of Saturday Night Takeaway and front a revamped version of the dating show Streetmate. Like us on Facebook
